title.justification: It is the title of the paper mentioned at the beginning and in the abstract.

extractions.description: This paper introduces Stochastic Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets), which extend traditional GFlowNets to environments with stochastic dynamics. By decomposing state transitions into deterministic and stochastic parts, the proposed method isolates environmental stochasticity and learns a dynamics model to capture it. Extensive experiments demonstrate the advantages of Stochastic GFlowNets over standard GFlowNets, MCMC, and RL-based approaches on various benchmarks.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results demonstrating the effectiveness of Stochastic GFlowNets across various benchmarks.
type.quote: Extensive experimental results demonstrate that Stochastic GFlowNets offer significant advantages over standard GFlowNets as well as MCMC- and RL-based approaches, on a variety of standard benchmarks with stochastic dynamics.

name.justification: The study primarily revolves around extending GFlowNets, which are related to reinforcement learning, to handle stochastic environments.
name.quote: to reinforcement learning [RL; Sutton and Barto, 2018]. Contrary to the typical reward-maximizing policy in RL

name.justification: The paper discusses Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) and extends them to stochastic generative settings.
name.quote: Generative Flow Networks (or GFlowNets for short)

name.justification: The paper introduces a dynamics model to capture environmental stochasticity, aligning with principles of model-based reinforcement learning.

name.justification: The GridWorld task is used to conduct experiments to understand the effectiveness of Stochastic GFlowNets.
name.quote: We first conduct a series of experiments in the GridWorld task introduced in Bengio et al. [2021a] to understand the effectiveness of Stochastic GFlowNets.
